acolyte.jdbc

Class AbstractCompositeHandler<T extends AbstractCompositeHandler>

  • java.lang.Object
    • acolyte.jdbc.AbstractCompositeHandler<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StatementHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompositeHandler

    public abstract class AbstractCompositeHandler<T extends AbstractCompositeHandler>
extends Object
implements StatementHandler
    Base for rule-based (immutable/thread-safe) statement handler.
    Author:
    Cedric Chantepie

      • isQuery

        public boolean isQuery(String sql)
        If statement is neither a PreparedStatement nor a CallbableStatement, determines whether given |sql| is a query. If returns true, whenSQLQuery will be called.
        Specified by:
        isQuery in interface StatementHandler
        Parameters:
        sql - the SQL statement to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the given SQL statement is a query, or false

      • withQueryDetection

        public T withQueryDetection(String... pattern)
        Returns an new handler based on this one, but including given query detection |pattern|. If there is already existing pattern, the new one will be used after.
        Parameters:
        pattern - Query detection pattern list
        Returns:
        New composite handler with given detection pattern
        Throws:
        PatternSyntaxException - If |pattern| is invalid
        See Also:
        withQueryDetection(java.util.regex.Pattern[])

      • withQueryDetection

        public abstract T withQueryDetection(Pattern[] pattern)
        Returns an new handler based on this one, but including given query detection |pattern|. If there is already existing pattern, the new one will be used after.
        Parameters:
        pattern - Query detection pattern
        Returns:
        Composition handler with the given detection pattern
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if pattern is null

      • queryDetectionPattern

        protected Pattern[] queryDetectionPattern(Pattern... pattern)
        Appends given |pattern| to current query detection.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the detection pattern
        Returns:
        the array of detection patterns
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if pattern is null
